reviews.review_msg: Laurence is such a sweet woman! She's expressed to me how she is wanting to change the French curriculum here at SFU which is great. She pushes for conveying ideas more than how perfect you can write in French, however syntax and grammar is still important (just 10-20% though). Her lectures are always engaging and always inspiring.

DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS I took this class as an easy A because I was in French immersion for 6 years and this course was tough even for me (semi fluet) She talked in French almost the entire class expecting everyone to understand her when very few did. You have oral exams paired with a random student and if they mess up you lose marks because of it.

You can tell that she is relatively new to instruction. But, her classes run well and she's very approachable. Her lectures are interesting but she can focus on one thing and test out another - or test on something that was mentioned briefly in class. Overall a decent instructor. And yes, she is gorgeous!
She is horrible on explaining things especially grammar, and she can give you hard time. if you wanna keep interesting in French, stay way, please
pretty good prof, make sure you study in your own time but that's normal for learning a language - she can't do the work for you.   And o-m-g she is gorgeous.

You can't really know until you're in there if shes teaching, it won't say when you sign up for the course. She's very kind but if you actually want to learn the subject she's not the teacher for you. She has trouble explaining things and isn't very good at actually teaching. She often made things much more complicated than really needed.
